CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: With a weight ratio of PSFDTBT to PC71BM is 1 : 3.5 , a PCE of 4.2% with a V oc of 0.96 V , a J sc of 7.6 mA / cm^2 , and an FF of 0.56 was achieved under illumination from an AM 1.5G solar simulator ( 100 mW cm^-2 ).

Let's think step by step.

In the given paragraph, the following are the "Material Name" entities:

1. PSFDTBT: This is the name of the material being compared to PC71BM.
2. PC71BM: This is the name of the material whose properties are being compared to those of PSFDTBT.

So, the two material names mentioned in the paragraph are:

1. PSFDTBT
2. PC71BM
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

Sure, here are the material names mentioned in the paragraph:

1. PSFDTBT
2. PC71BM

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the material names mentioned in the paragraph, presented in a Markdown table with one column titled "Material Name":

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PSFDTBT |
| PC71BM |

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: With a weight ratio of PSFDTBT to PC71BM is 1 : 3.5 , a PCE of 4.2% with a V oc of 0.96 V , a J sc of 7.6 mA / cm^2 , and an FF of 0.56 was achieved under illumination from an AM 1.5G solar simulator ( 100 mW cm^-2 ).

Let's think step by step.

In the given paragraph, the following are the "Property Name" entities:

1. PSFDTBT - "Photovoltaic System Efficiency"
2. PC71BM - "Photovoltaic Cell"
3. PCE - "Power Conversion Efficiency"
4. V oc - "Open-Circuit Voltage"
5. J sc - "Short-Circuit Current"
6. FF - "Fill Factor"

Note that these are all technical terms related to solar cells and photovoltaic systems, and they are used to describe various properties of the system or device under study.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Property.

Sure, here are the relevant entities in the paragraph that refer to material properties:

1. PSFDTBT - "Photovoltaic System Efficiency" (a material property)
2. PC71BM - "Photovoltaic Cell" (a material property)
3. PCE - "Power Conversion Efficiency" (a material property)
4. V oc - "Open-Circuit Voltage" (a material property)

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any other questions.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid entities in the paragraph that refer to material properties, presented in a Markdown table with one column "Property Name":

| Property Name |
| --- |
| PSFDTBT |
| PC71BM |
| PCE |
| V oc |

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any other questions.

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: With a weight ratio of PSFDTBT to PC71BM is 1 : 3.5 , a PCE of 4.2% with a V oc of 0.96 V , a J sc of 7.6 mA / cm^2 , and an FF of 0.56 was achieved under illumination from an AM 1.5G solar simulator ( 100 mW cm^-2 ).

Let's think step by step.

In the given paragraph, the following entities can be identified as "Property Value" entities:

1. PSFDTBT - "Property Value" entity: The weight ratio of PSFDTBT to PC71BM.
2. PC71BM - "Property Value" entity: The material used for comparison in the weight ratio.
3. PCE - "Property Value" entity: The power conversion efficiency of the solar cell, which is 4.2% in this case.
4. V oc - "Property Value" entity: The open-circuit voltage of the solar cell, which is 0.96 V in this case.
5. J sc - "Property Value" entity: The short-circuit current density of the solar cell, which is 7.6 mA/cm^2 in this case.
6. FF - "Property Value" entity: The fill factor of the solar cell, which is 0.56 in this case.

These entities are highlighted in the paragraph by using numerical values or units, which indicate that they are property values rather than other types of entities.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

Sure, here are the entities that refer to the value of material properties in the given paragraph:

1. PCE - "Property Value" entity: The power conversion efficiency of the solar cell, which is 4.2% in this case.
2. V oc - "Property Value" entity: The open-circuit voltage of the solar cell, which is 0.96 V in this case.

These entities are the only ones that refer to the value of material properties in the paragraph. The other entities mentioned (PSFDTBT, PC71BM) are not directly related to the value of material properties.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid entities related to material properties in the paragraph, presented in a Markdown table with one column titled "Property Value":

| Property Value |
| --- |
| PCE (4.2%) |
| V oc (0.96 V) |

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.
